Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ben_from_philly
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to Plaza de Espana and la Gran Via, but on a quiet side street, therefore we had no problems with noise. The room is not extremely spacious but not tiny either, and the bathroom was more spacious than we expected. The breakfast was adequate, the customer service was excellent, and the hotel was clean. Would highly recommend this little hotel. The only downside was that the beds were on the hard side, not too comfortable. Overall, no luxury, but great little hotel at a good location with wonderful service. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Cheap but Clean!”
Reviews.Author: mahendran_sella
Reviews.Content: It is located in center of the Madrid. Very convenient location. Very clean rooms and good choice of break fast and its free! Internet connection is free which is great. Lots of choice to eat around. Worth staying and the for the price the value is great!

Reviews.Title: “Fab little hotel”
Reviews.Author: pauline j
Reviews.Content: We got a taxi from airport for convenience on arrival was greeted by a lovely man who spoke very good English and wished me happy birthday nice little touch he booked us in quickly gave us a map with all local attractions . Our room was 103 at front of building yes the view was rubbish but beautifull room the buildings opposite unfortunately are empty and in need of repair and I think maybe squatters living in there but they didn't disturb us. Our room was very clean and very nice bathroom was wonderfull very large shower with lovely hot water 24 hours a day the maid does a fantastic job . We went straight out and found the local area we walked for miles the hotel is fantastic for sightseeing very central and very very close to metro.(plaza de espana) We had a great evening out finding local places 5 bottles beer 3 euros bargains The next morning as every morning we had a lovely breakfast at the hotel every thing you could want and very tasty . The heat outside the hotel was unbearable but inside aircon was lovely. We took the big red tourist bus for 20 euros hop and off all day great way to see the city and there are 2 routes 1 and 2 do both you get to see where everything is and what you want to see they also do night tour at 10 pm included in the price . We also went to Madrid footy stadium again well worth going . The bar at hotel was not to expensive and we had 1 drink in there but mostly we was out . I cannot fault this hotel or the staff . The street outside was a little dirty and Smelley at times NOT the hotels fault but they were cleaning out side on many occasions and some one had washed street the morning we was leaving with bleach. We got the metro back to airport so easy to use . We will return to this hotel if we come back to madrid

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissIzzy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here May 1-4 & enjoyed our stay. We arrived really early--some guests were still checking out--so our room wasn't ready. They held our bags while we got acquainted with the city. We found the staff to be cordial & professional and always willing to answer questions. They housekeeping staff were efficient and helpful, especially when we locked ourselves out of our room! I agree the hotel is a little dated, but it was clean, comfortable & convenient. The bathroom was large by European standards with marble floors and counters and a fabulous shower. The hotel is a little difficult for taxi drivers to find. It's located a block from Plaza Espana and convenient to the Royal Palace, Plaza Mayor, the Almudena Cathedral, & the Puerto del Sol. Please note that this hotel is located across the city from the museum district. A taxi ride to the Prado Museum costs around 6-7 Euros. The hotel is in an urban neighborhood with lots of small shops/bodegos. We got Cafe Americano & Cafe con Leche every morning at the bodego on the corner. Theresa knew all the regular customers and what they ordered. We were regulars after the first day! Lots of shopping and tapa bars as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all boxes for 3 stars (apart from noise)”
Reviews.Author: dar268
Reviews.Content: Good all round 3 stars, close to the Grand Via (main road that runs through Madrid) and walking distance from all the main sites. Rooms very clean and comfy beds. Breakfast simple but very tasty. Nice lobby with 2 computers (but WiFi extra). Fair value. Main down point was at times excessive noise; not clear if due to poor sound proofing or loud Spaniards or both! Largely quiet during sleeping hours though. Would I stay here again? Would probably try somewhere else for variety and hopefully more quietness. Nevertheless a decent good value 3 star in central Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TippyMike
Reviews.Content: Great place. Very quiet, yet located a street away from the center of the action. Close to everything it seems, and very clean. The room is spacious and there is internet PC in the lobby for quick email check-ups. Room has phone and TV+Cable. Very friendly staff and overall a very recommended spot. If you are looking for a ritzy 5 star hotel this isn't it, but it's very good value for the pay and you'll be staying in a quiet and clean dwelling space.

Reviews.Title: “For a decent stay”
Reviews.Author: VassoGreece
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and renovated. It's close to everything, Plaza de Espana, the Palace, Gran Via and 10 minutes walk from Plaza del Sol. The bathroom was brand new, the bed a bit old but OK. The breakfast was also OK. The only problem was the noise. Even though the hotel is on an alley, the windows aren't sound proff and I would wake up at six from the noise. Other than that, we were satisfied, it was very clean and the staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in convenient location, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: kshap
Reviews.Content: Good location a few minutes' walk from Plaza de Espana (in the heart of Madrid), good price for a comfortable and clean room and breakfast, wi-fi and the free use of a computer in the lobby. Around the corner from 2 friendly local bars. No reason for complaint, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent localization !”
Reviews.Author: Milena F
Reviews.Content: Hotel has just one problem...It´s a little bit noise, you could easily hear the conversation of your neighbours and not just conversation. But the localization is just perfect - I was in Madrid 3 days and I just catch subway from and to airport - the rest I was just walking - 8-10h per day and even in the night you dont need to catch taxi from latina or puerta do sol - since you can walk 20-30min to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel in an otherwise complete disaster.”
Reviews.Author: Cat_buxton
Reviews.Content: Stayed in January, folllowing other hotels in Spain the rates were less than half of what they would be in the summer. after being abandoned in Alicante by ryanair and geting a 400euro taxi through a blizzard to try and make it to a concert which a friend was playing in Cason del Tormes were our shining light. the staff were sympathetic, helpful and understanding, possibly as it wasn't very busy but still, they were. Made and excellent base for the rest of our stay, central loaction, breakfast was fantastic and as i spent alot of time in the bar trying to finish uni work the bar man sympathised with lots of hot chocolate!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: quality13
Reviews.Content: Casón del Tormes Hotel is 3 min walk from to Plaza de Espana,but in quiet side road. Metro station 3 min walk as well.Airport (get the free map from Airport tourism office, it is better than the map in the hotels to hotel, by tube, you need to change only once and really practical and easy to use tube system!Nice restaurants and shopping near by Reception clean, receptionist friendly and helpful. One lift and worked well. Room 311 on 3rd floor (Twnb).Requested double, but not available Bathroom was clean,hand shower in bath (two small bottles of Shampoo, and two very small soaps, package of tissue , shoe cleaner).Hot water was warm, but not hot! Small flat screen TV (15 inch,several local stations and BBC world).Booked Wifi (5 Euro /24 hours usage) and it was reasonable fast.Aircom available, heating through radiator.Room was warm.Bed comfortable (even I don't like SGL beds). Only disadvantage was soundproof. You can hear next door people very well, and upstairs noises. Everybody (this time) seem to go to bed 11 pm and wake up about 7 pm.You could also hear corridor noises.Brfst Eur 9.50.Ok, very basic continental.Bread and pastry selection ok, other stuff was very limited. Would I stay again? If sound proof was better in the room (hopefully they will give different room next time), yes.Location is excellent, and room/Htl is clean! No street noise!By the way, my room was straight opposite of residential accommodations, so remember to keep your net curtains closed.This did not bother me as I was in the room in the eve/night and in the morning left to conference. So over all, if you do not mind external noise, and you want clean, basic 3 star hotel in the heart of Madrid, this is great hotel!Rate wise reasonable.Booked it through booking.com

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: sarahgailey
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely wonderful stay at the Cason in November! It was my first time in Spain, and this hotel was offered through a package with EuropeanDestinations. The staff at the hotel was the best! They spoke excellent English, helped us with every question we had and had great recommendations for Dinner and a Flamenco show. They even set us up with reservations at both locations where we treated like special guests for the evening! The hotel is located just a bit off the main road, but the area is very safe, a quick walk to the metro, Plaza Espana, bars and restaruants and the palace. We had no problems at all using the metro to get around the city, we absolutely loved every minute in Madrid! I thank everyone at the Cason for their help, we really had the best time!

Reviews.Title: “nice & cosy for good price”
Reviews.Author: amirim
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very good! they welcomed us with a big smile and an intent to help. They gave us a map of the city, directions and recommendation. the rooms were warm and pleasant. breakfast was good and varied. The hotel is located on a small quiet street (near "Gran Via" and "Plaza Espana") wich is very important if you want to sleep at night (Madrid's street's are very busy and noisy at night!!) and to get to a Metro station. there are two computers with free internet at the lobby- for the guests to use for free We didn't like that the WIFI in rooms costs money! The parking is a bit expensive

Reviews.Title: “A gem,, good rooms,,good location,,no free wifi though”
Reviews.Author: Atulwalia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights...only reason for 4 and not a 5 star rating is very expensive wifi.. Good: Great spacious rooms, and relatively big bathrooms with clean towels...location is awsome,, ok so you dont get a great view but you are just off the main road.. less than a 2 min walk away from Plaza Espana.. and about 5 min walk from the royal palace,,, takes you less than a min to get to a metro..and in about 5-10 min you can reach Gran via..lots ot eat and shop nearby as well.. to top it of it is quiet enough for a good sleep..cmfortable beds,,staff is helpful and polite.. not so good: Wifi is expensive for the room cost they are charging.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Beverley601
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week with a group of girlfriends, excellent location close to Royal Palace and Opera House, easy to hop on and off the City Tour buses too (we had a 2 day pass which was great value for money). Hotel clean, quiet and staff all very helpful, our stay included breakfast and I wasn't personally impressed, bit basic but the rest of the girls liked it. Would recommend and certainly use again if ever back in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a central location”
Reviews.Author: Sandeep M
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel very close to the metro station. The rooms are large and quiet. The wi-fi worked well. We stayed for three nights and the manager helped us plan our various outings. We found it very convenient to move around in Madrid. Overall it was worth the money paid for and it was on a quiet street very close to the main street.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: ASousa
Reviews.Content: We arrive into Madrid (first leg of our trip), picked up our rental and headed to our hotel. We found this hotel through trip advisor reviews. The hotel is close to most major spots so you can easily walk - but if you have a car it is about 24Euro/day to park at the hotel and they have to drive with you a couple blocks away to park in their garage, which is behind the police station! Trying to find parking on the street was vert difficult! The room is small and clean, like most hotels in Europe the walls are thin, so you can hear everything. Our room was at the front of the hotel facing the main side street, so if you can try and request a room on that side as the noise from outside was not as loud. Wi-Fi is not free and there is not a mini fridge (found this to be common in all the hotels we stayed at in Spain). There are two PC's in the lobby and internet and printing there is free. Service was great and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. We did not opt for breakfast as you will find once you are out there are tons of cafes along some of the side streets where you may spend about 10-12Euro for two people. Overall this hotel meet our needs as we really only needed a place to sleep, shower, etc for the four days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quite comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jacob432
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to many attractions of central Madrid, but on a quite side alley. Service was good and the room confortable. Breakfast costs almost 10 euro per person and is not rich, but sufficient. Internet near the bar is free, in room costs extra.

Reviews.Title: “a few steps away from la Vida Loca de Madrid”
Reviews.Author: LellaSS
Reviews.Content: This small and cosy hotel is close to Plaza de Espana and just a few steps away from the hectic Gran Via and the major attractions. It is actually located in a tiny street very close to the Royla Palace and the Opera House as well as Casa de Campo ( a massive park if you wish to take a stroll or to enjoy an healthy running session), The staff was very friendly and helpful and the rooms quite spacious. Personally I found the pillows not very comfy. The bathroom was basic,, but it provided all the toiletries. One drawback was that the iNTERNET CONNECTION wasn't free (but this is common in MADRID). bUT ONE COULD TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE TWO COMPUTERS FREE OF CHARGE LOCATED IN THE LOBBY. tHE STAFF proved to be very helpful when they allowed us to leave our luggage the whole day after our check out. Would definitely go back again

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: artique
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Madrid, so we went by other people's reviews on hotels in the 'central' area. This couldn't have been any more central. It is located on a quiet street that is so close to a Metro that we had no delays getting anywhere. Add to that that the staff was really friendly and welcoming to us. The room was simple, but not 'old fashion - they had a small flat screen TV, a very newly upgraded bathroom that was really modern and nice. The bed (we had a 'matrimony' bed) was firmer than I would've liked, but I made do. The rooms are on the small size but that's because we Americans are used to wasted space and that 'big is better'. We spent every day walking to the nearby Palacio Real, Metro, great restaurants/tabernas, and Plazas that we never spend time thinking it was 'too small'.. it was perfect for getting to a lot of places within walking distance and sleeping in a safe, clean, welcoming hotel. Also, the breakfast there (extra cost) was very filling and average. Some of the food was a bit 'odd' to me (boiled weiners, soft bacon), but the Spanish Tortilla and the danishes and the breads were very good for a convenient breakfast. They offer loads of drinks (automated espresso machine, coffee, milk, water, OJ, other fruit juices ('zumos')) and cereals and such. Like I said, good for a convenient breakfast that is filling, it's a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very near plaza espana”
Reviews.Author: samisamet
Reviews.Content: rooms are a bit small and old fashion except bathroom.it is 5 minutes walking distance to metro stations and 1 minutes to plaza de espana.receptionist are frindly and helpful.breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a good price”
Reviews.Author: ldv09
Reviews.Content: Great location, very easy to find. Located just off the subway stop, down the street from the Senate and the Royal Palace. Quiet & safe neighbourhood. Just a 2 minute walk from Gran Via, which leads to all the major sites of the city & good shopping. Hotel staff was very friendly and kindly stored our luggage after we checked out while we finished touring the city. Breakfast was basic but good. All in all, good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: lakey_90
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very comfortable and a great price as we booked last minute. The room we had was very spacious and the bathroom was great. The staff were very friendly and helpful with how to get around and places to go. They also showed us to the underground parking which cost an extra few euros a night. There is WiFi available in the rooms for 5€ a night (i think), however there are computers in the lobby that has free internet which I found to be better to use. The location is great, close to cafes, bars, shopping and tourist attractions. Would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AbidinginHim
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. It is walking distance to several sites, and it is very close to the metro (4 euros round trip) to & from the airport. Bring earplugs, the trash trucks are very noisy at night. We were able to use the internet in the lobby for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ppppp_7
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Staff very friendly and helpful, excellent and safe location, breakfast was decent (expensive for what you get), no wife but computers with free internet access, great shower!, beds a little uncomfortable

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet side street, very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: adl235
Reviews.Content: Great location near Palacio Real and Gran Via (think Times Square), but on quiet side street. Easy access from airport via metro to Plaza de Espana stop. Friendly and helpful English-speaking deesk staff. Nice lobby with free internet terminals (no printer) and nice small bar. Room was a litte spartan, but clean and comfortable. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly funny staff, good location, great value”
Reviews.Author: cmys152
Reviews.Content: Located beside Plaza d'Espania at the end of Gran via this hotel was great value, clean, and the reception staff were very helpful funny and friendly. Quirky local tapas bar on the corner and 2 mins walk from the Palace - I'd really reccommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly clean quiet and comfortable, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Davedd
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for 3 nights and were delighted with the hotel for the price we paid. The room was spotlessly clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and very helpful. We could leave our bags as long as we liked after checking out. As others have said the breakfast was nothing to write home about at 9 euros. We used VIPS on Gran Via - also not wonderful but half the price. If you are looking at art galleries the Thyssen is breathtaking without the queues we saw at the Prado. We would definitely use this hotel again. Dave & Beryl Watchet Somerset

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: spikewoo
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, 50 meters from Gran Via/Plaza de Espana, very clean, old but pretty,very quiet in the very center of Madrid. Smart and reliable people working, Morning breakfast adeguate (even though not rich and without a real coffee).

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Gran Via”
Reviews.Author: Tango01
Reviews.Content: All in all I would strongly recommend this hotel. Pros: near the gran via and the subway station, friendly service (very helpful), large rooms and bathroom as well, quiet and calm despite its vecinity to the Gran Via. Cons: mediocre breakfast (I would have my breakfast somewhere else), uncomfortable beds (unless you like sleeping like a fakir), very expensive parking, no room service or minibar (dont need it anyway with such a lovely city). PS: I would strongly recommend a short trip to: Avila, Toledo and Las rozas for "power shopping".

Reviews.Title: “Average but good location.”
Reviews.Author: hermante
Reviews.Content: Located in a side alley very close to a central metro station. Booked this hotel because it was the cheapest hotel available in Madrid a week before our stay. Our requirements are: easy to get to, and reasonable amenities i.e. no shared bathroom. The room was big which made it seem empty. The TV was a flat screen monitor about 21 inches, but worked fine. No kettle, no fridge. Room was a bit dark, key was very big which made it uncomfortable to carry around all day. Toilet was not spotless, but the other hotels we stayed in were 4 star so can't expect too much. Beds were fine, unlike other posters here we slept soundly and did not hear any noise. Stayed on a Monday night though. Also unlike other posters here, we found the staff a bit rude and did not speak English well. I speak a bit of Spanish but have trouble understanding the accent. I spoke to two members of staff here and I needed them to repeat themselves before I understood. When we arrived, I told the check in staff that we had a reservation. He then looked at me weirdly and asked if I had a reservation. I said, yes, that's what I told you, and I said my name. He then typed something on his computer, looked confused, rummaged around his desk, and then saw a single piece of paper on top of the counter, which he had been looking at for the previous guest!. I had already located my name on that list, so to make things easier I decided to give him my passport as I just learned that Spain requires hotels to check the passports of guests. However he then gave me a weird look again and asked me whether the reservation was in my name or my girlfriend's name. I was thinking that it doesn't matter as I already gave him a name. He finally decided that maybe he should open my passport if he didn't understand how to say the alphabet in English (my name is spelled unusually, for which he can be forgiven). He then recorded my passport details but didn't bother to open my girlfriend's passport. Lastly, he spent about 2 minutes trying to explain that we needed to pay when we left. The other hotels we stayed in did not bother to say that, so it was unexpected. I expect he says this to every guest so I wonder why he has not learned how to express it properly in English. The other member of staff I spoke to also behaved oddly. We didn't fancy the hotel breakfast so went outside at 7.30 to find a cafe. The man shouted very loudly at us "when leave the hotel you give me the key". I said, "we're going to get some breakfast". He replied "breakfast upstairs". I said, "we're getting breakfast by ourselves", at which he looked confused and didn't say anything for a while, so I said, "we're checking out at 10 o'clock". He then nodded and looked away. This made me feel like we were thieves or something. We had no bags with us the time, and the previous day nobody said anything when they saw us walk out in the afternoon. Anyway, I think we could have had a better hotel if we searched and booked earlier, but this was adequate. Apart from those two interactions nothing went wrong. In fact, a chambermaid we passed on the landing was quite friendly even though we only managed to communicate briefly with our basic Spanish.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with Hotel Cason del Tormes”
Reviews.Author: ChrisIngolstadt
Reviews.Content: I'll keep it short... Hotel is very close to the mega busy Gran Via, but very quiet though as it is located in a quiet side alley. It's just a few steps away from the underground, small shops etc. Stuff was very friendly, breakfast was good (not 5 star-ish), the room was clean, and the laundry service worked very well. Rooms could be bigger and have more modern furniture, but for the price the room was definitely spacious enough. There are two PCs in the lobby providing free Internet access, Wireless access is available for a little extra charge (works very well) I would definitely return to this Hotel next time I'm in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, good location, and quiet”
Reviews.Author: FallsChurchTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night in early October 2010, the first night after we arrived in Spain. This hotel is on a quiet side street in a busy part of town, close to attractions on the western side of the central downtown area. The staff spoke better English than we spoke Spanish, and were very helpful and understanding to us and did their best to allow us to check in early. Our room was clean and quiet, and the breakfast buffet a good value.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AnaMaria-Lisbon
Reviews.Content: Close to Plaza de España metro station and located in the city center of Madrid this is an ideal hotel for those who want to spend a couple of days in Madrid. The room was modern, large enough for us and with several clothes closets. The bathroom was very clean and pleasant. From this hotel you can easly find the Royal Palace and you can continue walking to Plaza Mayor, Puerta de Sol, etc. For quality/price I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “big, clean and good price”
Reviews.Author: kadoc10802
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple of times and I don´t have a single complain. The double room was really big, with a big bathroom. Everything was really clean and the stuff was nice (they helped me with my luggage). The location of the hotel is really good and it´s in a small quite street, you can sleep very good in night (the only problem is that the quality of sheets is not very good). The price was good for the quality and location of the hotel although breakfast was not included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: babis_d
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an economical and convenient stay in Madrid then this hotel will suit you fine. The location is very good, just a couple of minutes away from a metro station, and it is away from the main road so it is quiet. The rooms although rather old, they were ok and clean with a comfortable bed with a spacey bathroom. The breakfast was adequate with not much variety. The staff was friendly and helpful if you needed directions or advices for sightseeing and stuff like that. Another plus for the hotel is that although during my checkout I forgot in the room a bag full of souvenirs from Madrid, after contacting them they arranged to send all the stuff in my place in Greece. So overall I had a nice experience from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: entropicp
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. We got a special summer rate for a double at 60 euros per night, after bailing out of an awful place we had booked on Hostelworld. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was very clean and a good size. It was also on a quiet side street off the Gran Via so it had a great location minus the traffic noise. Only downsides were that the beds were a bit hard and that it lacks any charm or character as it is mainly designed for business travellers (feels a bit like a Holiday Inn). Overall great place though!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MyMp
Reviews.Content: Practical location, good breakfast, quiet place and staff, ready to help.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: esthergoesasia
Reviews.Content: Thumbs up for this hotel. Ideal location in the city centre, yet no noise from traffic or loud people in the streets. Feels very safe to walk there at night as it is located right next to the Spanish Senate. Friendly reception staff, small but spotless rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place to Stay while in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: bobecus
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cason Del Tormes last month for a week while in Madrid. This is a small boutique style hotel with a good location, excellent front desk service and is very clean. It is a basic hotel - small room (however, we were usually not in the room anyway). Just a couple of areas for improvement - breakfasts could have been better - more variety, egg dish tasted more like a potato omelet, etc. Water pressure in our room was not good at all, however, we managed. Air conditioning worked well and was quiet. I would recommend this property, however, there was room for improvement in the couple of areas that I listed

Reviews.Title: “This place was a winner”
Reviews.Author: travelinfoolfromtx
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked a little scary from the outside at first to us American tourists (not used to the narrow streets, etc.) but was very nice inside. The lobby is lovely. The staff was courteous and helpful, spoke English and tolerated my Spanish well. Our room was not fancy, but clean and modern - the A/C worked well, and there were English cable news channels. The mattress was pretty firm (which I like) and we slept well in spite of occasional noises from the street. The breakfast every morning was great. But the best thing about this place is the location, on the northwest edge of the old city. A few hundred feet from the front door is a grocery (run by a Spanish-speaking Chinese gent) which also sells wine, liquor and ice. And just one block away is the Metro station! You are connected to EVERYWHERE. Cason del Tormes is also a short walk from the Palacio Real and Templo Debod. There are lots of shops and restaurants on Gran Via one block from the hotel. And the open-top tourist bus stops two blocks away. We thought this was a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great service.”
Reviews.Author: WistaWio
Reviews.Content: I have only positive things to say about this property. Its location is very convenient. Close to all the sights and city center. The Royal Palace is only a couple of blocks away. Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol are within walking distance. The hotel is actually next door to the Spanish Senate. Plaza de Espana metro station is just around the corner so you can travel anywhere within the city in minutes. The staff at the hotel is extreamly friendly and is more than willing to assist you with any questions or requests. You really feel welcome there!! The rooms are clean and comfortable. Quite adequate for this hotel's 3 star rating. I would highly recommend this place and certainly would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find, great value”
Reviews.Author: CoupleWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We travelled to watch a Real Madrid game and found this hotel great value. The staff were very accomodating, especially Anthony the night porter. Would fully recommend. Great location, minutes walk to Plaza del Sol.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful staff in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: HHHYYY
Reviews.Content: This is a great value 3 star hotel. 3 min from Pl. Espana metro station. (maybe less) Many restaurants and bars around and it is nice to walk down to Sol area. Many shops and restaurants along the big street so you never get bored. If you take metro, Plaza Mayor is just few stops from here. (could walk too) Room is a basic. we had triple room 2 twin bed and 1 extra sofa/twin bed in a room. OK for 3 adults. Bath room didn't have tub. But decent size. Nice and Clean. No fridge in a room but front desk personnel kept stuff for us. Hotel staff were very helpful and kind to all of our needs. They all speak good English. They also taught us Spanish too. They recommended great places around the area. Free internet PC is located at lobby area. That is a plus if you don't bring your PC with you. Hotel could print out for us free of charge! I really liked local tapas and bars/cafes in this area. Not really touristy. so you can try to order in Spanish (or just even try to). The wall between rooms could be thin. We could hear neighbors talking.... So this is up to your luck. If you have a couple fighting all night long, bad luck. But if no one is next door, you can sleep peacefully.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great service & a really good location”
Reviews.Author: KT0000
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights & were delighted with the location, cleanliness, service & comfort. This is real value for money & we would recommend it to anyone wanting a great mid-range hotel as it's way better than most.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Excellent service, great location, affordable price..”
Reviews.Author: TerrySandra
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews we were a bit aprehensive, but decided to book it anyway because the price was extremely reasonable compared to other hotels. We were very happy we did! The reception staff could not do enough for you, really friendly and helpful; the room was clean and the bed was comfortable. We didn't really have any problems with the walls (a common gripe amongst other reviewers, which scared us a bit as my husband is such a light sleeper). The area was Ok, as it was very central and close to everything, we felt safe at night and lucky that we were near so many bars, restaurants, metro, etc. The one thing we can't report on is the food, as we didn't opt for the breakfast, so sorry we can't help there! All in all, we loved it and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Casondel Tormes”
Reviews.Author: Sootsylv
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Cason del Tormes from the 14 May to 18 May 2009. We found this to be an excellent hotel for our short stay. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, the staff were very polite and spoke reasonable English. The buffet breakfast was excellent. The hotel was situated conveniently central, close to shops and the Metro at Plaza Espana.

Reviews.Title: “functional and friendly”
Reviews.Author: jodyodea
Reviews.Content: This hotel is highly rated on tripadvisor (ranked 24th at time of review), but that surprised me a little. However, if you are looking for good value and friendly service then it's probably the hotel for you. Yes, it's got a good location, right behind Plaza De Espana and Gran Via, but there are countless hotels in this area. However the trade off is that it's located on a rather sorry-looking little side street. The hotel doesn't look great from the outside, but inside it's reasonably warm, with friendly service from reception staff. Walls between rooms are thin, and you can hear pretty much anything going on next door, but reading reviews for other, more expensive hotels, this is probably the norm in Madrid. Our room was a good size, spotlessly clean with comfortable beds and nice bathroom. No minibar though (which can be handy to keep your own purchased drinks cool). Choose this hotel if you are not interested in paying a bit more for something "funky", and instead want something that is more on comfort and value rather than style. Don't choose it based on location, there are lots of other hotels in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lamboDundalk
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cason Del Tormes is an excellent little hotel at the top of the Gran Via .The staff are friendly and speak good English and very helpful for information and advice. Had booked a single room but got a twin room at no extra charge!!. Rooms and bathroom were spotless clean and was more than big enough for my needs . Breakfast is not included in the price but quite frankly there are dozens of good little cafes within a stones throw of the hotel that I did not take hotel`s fare.The hotel is almost right beside the Metro (Plaza de Espana) but down a side street and can be a little hard to find .It is a short walk from the hotel to the Royal Palace.The Prado and other sites are at the other end of the Gran Via and although a good walk is certainly worth it to take in the sites and sounds of Madrid`s main street. I found no noise problems with rooms that have been reported in other reviews.All in all a good stay in the Cason del Tormes. Would have no problem staying again on a return visit

Reviews.Title: “good value clean well located 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: jorichards
Reviews.Content: Cason del Tormes is a well located hotel just 5 minutes walk from the Royal palace , Grand via and Plaza Espana , It is located on a little road off the Grand via with not much traffic as its a one way only street and has a dead end at the bottom. Ask at reception to recommend the restaurant on the corner of the street, its an excellent old style spanish theme with great food and wine. The hotel is very clean and staff are helpful but rooms are small , beds uncomfortable and walls paper thin , so overall a mixed review !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Rogeraldo
Reviews.Content: Excellent location easy to reach everywhere from by tube (metrobus) or Madrid Vision (open top tour bus : Euro 16 for 1 day or Euro 20 for 2 days). Also easy to reach from the airport (5 stops on the pink line no. 8; then 4 stops on the blue line no. 10 to Plaza de Espana - about 30 minutes in all). Then only a 2 minute walk to the hotel, which is down a side street, and therefore quiet from traffic and late nighters on their way home. Hotel was clean & tidy with pleasant English speaking staff, Yes the walls are a bit thin, but then so is all budget accomodation. Breakfasts simple, but more than adequate. Hotel more a B&B than a hotel, as nothing to do there, and therefore may not be ideal for children. However for a comfortable base to explore Madrid from, it was ideal. Would fully recommend it and stay again. For football (& non footie) fanatics, a trip to Real Madrid's ground (the Bernabau) is a must - by Madrid Vison buses. Tip - keep you bags, etc. glued to your arms or chests, as many thieves in town. We had a bag stolen, and met many people in the same position at the police station!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: L_Braybrook
Reviews.Content: A good hotel located on a quiet street very close to Gran Via and within a short walk of the Royal Palace. The galleries are further away but if you don't want to walk the hotel is a five minute walk from the Plaza Espana metro station. Our bedroom and bathroom were a decent size and very clean and the hotel staff were very pleasant and friendly. Breakfast is in a large ground floor room and is a self-service buffet with a reasonable choice of; pastries, cold meats, cereal, etc. We booked through Cresta holidays and paid what I think was a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, fully functional”
Reviews.Author: Didsbury_Ryder
Reviews.Content: Very well located for the Grand Via, Plaza de Espana, Royal Palace, and Opera, this is a friendly, functional large hotel. The room was large, if a bit dated, with a large and pleasant bathroom. The staff were very polite and helpful, and it was a good-value stopover for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, if in an out-of-the-way location”
Reviews.Author: PVCampbell
Reviews.Content: This is a clean and quiet hotel just far enough off Gran Via to be away from the noise and bustle of the city, but close enough to everything to be quite convenient. Just two blocks to the Metro and within walking distance of many attractions. It is a long walk to the Prado, but do-able. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the hotel is very clean and the rooms are spacious by European standards. This appears to be a somewhat business-oriented hotel, with no views, restaurant or busy lobby, but for a place to use as a base for time in Madrid, it fits the bill nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Quite Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Ed_Paul
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently situated on a fairly quiet street between the Royal Palace area and what appears to be Madrid's Chinatown. The surrounding areas are an attractive blend of old and new. The hotel is fine for a 'no frills' tourist, like me. My room was quite comfortable, and the lobby and breakfast room are impressively large and very clean. The Reception staff are friendly and helpful, and are happy to let a foreigner speak to them in Spanish. (It can be irritating to be automatically addressed as though one can only speak English.) The only slight problem was that the street (la Calle del Rio) was sometimes noisy at night, but the trip as a whole was extremely satisfying. 'Tengo muchas ganas de volver a visitar Madrid.'

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anubhav_Ag
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights here and found the hotel fairly well located. I cant find anything wrong with the hotel - it was nice, cozy, clean, safe - which is what you need. It was well located vis-a-vis the Madrid Vision Tour bus. I read some reviews that the bar was unmanned. Frankly, that was not an issues for us. the staff was corteous and the desk was able to help us a lot for planning the sight seeing - this is important if you speak only english. I could easily go back to this hotel. It does not stand out as stupendous or the best ever but is definitely a good hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot”
Reviews.Author: PetteriHelsinki
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location just near Plaza Espagna, Gran Via and Plaza Callao. The interior of the hotel is nothing fancy, but the rooms are nice and roomy, eventhough the matresses and pillows in beds are quite uncomfortable and there might be some noise from the neighbors. The location itself is quiet though. The breakfast is not included in the price, which is good. It's not worth visiting - there are good cafes just around the corner for half the price and nicer settings... The staff were friendly and helpful. We had a pleasant stay! Petteri / Finland PS. Go to see Real Madrid's home game - it is worth every cent:...)

Reviews.Title: “Safe, comfortable, clean and CENTRAL”
Reviews.Author: kahmedsid
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we checked in on our Spain-Morocco trip. It was very difficult to decide where to stay in Madrid because of the 100's of choices near the Gran Via (you should always stay near the Gran Via) and several Hostel choices. After checking in and spending 2 days at this hotel, I was extremely satisfied with the helpful staff, the extremely central location (right next to Plaza Espana off of Gran Via) and the presence of a free safe box in the room to store your passports, etc. The staff provided us with maps and helpful tips about where to go and where not to go late at night but if you stay here, you will easily figure out all places to see, it's in the smack center of all the activity in Madrid, yet on a very quiet street with a dead end - so you will hear no noise from the street (BIG PLUS). However, in all the hotels I have stayed in Spain and Morocco - do not expect absolute silence in your room from outside. It didn't bother us at all; but if little noise bothers you from the corridor or the room next doors - you should consider a hotel which guarantees noise-free rooms (probably 5 star). Also, since we were there to see Madrid and not the hotel, we only spent the night at the hotel and it was very comfortable. The bathroom which is always very important was squeaky clean or else it would have been a show stopper. I would stay away from the 1000's of hostels which were to be seen in every building we walked by in the city and some of them looked scary (seriously). I'd stay here again. Oh and if you can be in madrid on a Sunday you will be able to experience the El Rastro flea market which was an experience in its own. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “First time to Madrid”
Reviews.Author: djl0801
Reviews.Content: We have just had our first visit to Madrid, and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We stayed at the 'Cason del Tormes' hotel which was extremely clean and friendly. We had a problem with our transfers from and to the airport and the reception staff at the hotel sorted it out immediately with no problems at all. The hotel itself is situated down a side street just off the main street (Gran Via), so it wasn't too noisy. So if you're looking for a busy city break but still wanting a good nights sleep this hotel is very reccommended. We will definitly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: swnw99
Reviews.Content: Just come back from 4 nights at the Cason Del Tormes. All in all a good place to stay in Madrid. On a quiet street just off the Gran Via so just a few minutes walk to bars, restaurants, shops, stop for the tour bus or the metro. Also just 5 minutes walk to the Real Palace and lots of gardens/parks within 5 minutes walk. Staff very helpful, lobby area very nice, and has free internet access. Breakfast average continental fare, ours was included in the package, wouldn't bother if you had to pay extra for it. Only complaint was lack of restaurant for dinner, but plenty of choice within a few minutes walk. The bar in the lobby never seemed to be open, you had to ask the person on reception if you wanted a drink and they then arranged for someone to come and serve you. Would have been better if it had been open with someone on there during opening hours. Having said all that would definitely stay here again as the location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: MartinAdrogué
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel with an excellent price, and I really recommend it. The service is very good, the staff -though a bit scarce- is friendly and helpful. The hotel is small and very confortable. The rooms are quite big, specially for European standards, most of them external with nice street views. The beds are confortable and the bathroom is OK. The location is the best point. It´s in a hiden but extremely convenient place: just a few steps from Royal Palace, the Senate, Plaza de España, Gran Vía, Royal Theatre and many other attractions. There are a parking and a metro station just around the corner. A silent refuge in the heart of noisy Madrid. Conclusion: basic but confortable hotel in an unique spot of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very good value for money. Exceedingly friendly, polite and helpful staff. Rooms are air conditioned, heated and contain safe deposit boxes. Four floors with a lift. Breakfast comprises various teas, coffee, chocolate, fruit juice, fruit, cereals, hams, cheese, toast, Danish pastries and cakes. Laundry service if required. Coach service to return to airport available. A short walk to Plaza de España Metro station and Calle Gran Via.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money but avoid the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Badgersbadgers
Reviews.Content: A pleasant, clean and comfortable hotel in a very good location. It is just off the Gran Via and there is a Metro stop at the end of the road, which was very convenient for getting around the city and to and from the airport. Off a side road, it was also very quiet. The staff were very friendly and helpful and offered to look after our bags when we checked out which, is always good when you have the rest of the day until your flight. Our only advice would be to avoid the breakfast. It worked out at six Euro's per person, which we wouldn't have minded except that it was rather basic, all self-service and clearly, out-of-a-packet, even the coffee was from a vending machine. We could have ate out and had breakfast for half the price. But minor complaints aside, the Cason Del Tormes was very good value for money and we would recommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: Cason del Tormes
